item.title: Recently planted saplings are dead / dying., 15th July
item.description:
Recently planted saplings near silt trap above broken bridge have died. They need to be replanted.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stone Park Avenue, Eden Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Overgrown foliage blocking view at junction, 15th July
item.description:
The grass verge of the pavement has been allowed to become a little garden which is fine but now the foliage is growing 6 foot tall and causing an obstruction at this particular junction. The man who is tending to this garden has now also parked. He’s gardening van in front of it which further obstruct the view when you’re trying to pull out of Apex close. This an accident waiting to happen.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Apex Close, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tag on food waste bin, 15th July
item.description:
As above

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72-74, St George's Square, Pimlico, London

item.title: Hedge outside numbers 77/79 is obstructing pavement, 15th July
item.description:
The hedge has been left to grow so far into the pavement that it’s difficult to pass if you have a pram, kids or a wheelchair. This needs to be cut back so people aren’t forced to walk in the road, especially when you’re trying to pass someone there.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 77, Henslowe Road, East Dulwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 126 Felixstowe Road: bags of rubbish., 15th July
item.description:
Bags of rubbish added to the carpet that has been alongside 126 Felixstowe Road for months. Please remove carpet and bags of rubbish.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Felixstowe Road, Abbey Wood, London

item.title: Hole filled with wood chippings left by the company who removed the tree stump, 15th July
item.description:
A large hole that is filled with fine wood chippings, that is now blowing across the pavement. Animals have started to dig it up, scattering it across the pavement

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 204, Venner Road, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Waste left all over the street, 15th July
item.description:
No 30 Chandler Way leave their waste on the street on a consistently regular basis for many months now. They live their overflowing bins on the pavement because of their choice to do that their waste ends up on the street. At times they also leave their rubbish all around the tree nearest to them causing serious obstruction to the extent the pavement can not be used at all. Today they left dirty nappies and household waste on the street outside no28 and no 26 chandler way again causing a serious health and safety hazard. This is happening too much with no regard for the health and safety of neighbours and passers by causing potential risks to health and safety. Enough is enough this has been going on for almost a year now.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Diamond Street, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep potholes line, 15th July
item.description:
In middle of road there is a deep elongated pothole at the exact point where bikes have to pass by a regularly parked caged truck. Bikes coming down the hill have to be very careful to avoid the pothole which would certainly smash their wheel, throwing riders off, if they hit it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oxhawth Crescent, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree requires cutting, 15th July
item.description:
This tree grows at a very fast pace for me to keep up with cutting it. It whips the public in their faces and also the root is causing the paving slabs to lift. It’s a major trip hazard. I have to report this at least a couple of times a year because I can’t keep cutting it with the lace it grows at.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Village Way, Eden Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Littering along railway side Holmdale Terrace, 15th July
item.description:
Please clean litter at Hackney end of Holmdale terrace. Littering left by vehicle owners.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Holmdale Terrace, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Badly overflowing drain, 15th July
item.description:
This drain is a persistent issue. It has a rancid smell which comes through windows on Corbiere House, impacting the ability to open windows. Also poses serious issues for dogs in the park.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): De Beauvoir Estate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary lights with no permit and no workforce, 15th July
item.description:
There are temporary traffic lights on Crofton Lane near the junction with Derwent Drive. These have no permit, are not listed on the Bromley roadworks map and have no workforce doing any work on them. They are causing significant amounts of congestion as they have no manual timing adjustment despite being very close to the pedestrian crossing which compounds the issues. This has been reported but no answers provided after 4 days.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 86, Crofton Lane, Poverest, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Missing Give Way lines, 15th July
item.description:
Painted Give Way lines at the end of Speldhurst Road are missing, which is potentially dangerous. Line of sight onto Moulins Road, which is part of a school bike bus route, is difficult. There is NO excuse for not having markings here!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Speldhurst Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
